Planned Giving

## What is The Peace Light Legacy Program?

The history of Gettysburg and Adams County is built on the legacies of those who came before us. With the help of many generous supporters across the nation, the Adams County Historical Society (ACHS) now has a proper home to share and preserve its vital community stories. By visiting the Historical Society’s new archives, library, event center, and nationally acclaimed  _Beyond the Battle Museum_ , millions of visitors and community members of all ages will continue to find inspiration from our shared past.

Planned Giving is a way to help ensure that the mission of ACHS continues for generations to come. The Peace Light Legacy Program has been established to honor individuals who have committed to support ACHS through deferred gifts, and who have informed us of their intentions. 

## Joining the Peace Light Legacy Program

If you have already made arrangements to give to ACHS in your will or another form of deferred giving, you are currently eligible to join the Peace Light Legacy Program. Please notify us of your plans by completing this **[form](/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/2023-Planned-Giving-.pdf) **and returning it to us.

## Why Become a Member?

Since 1888, the Adams County Historical Society (ACHS) has preserved millions of historic items that tell the story of our world-famous community. Now, YOU can be part of this important work by becoming a member of ACHS! 

Members enjoy many benefits, including free admission to _Beyond the Battle Museum_ and the Shriver House Museum, discounted tickets for tours and events, and so much more! To learn more, visit our [**Membership FAQs Page**](/membership-faq/ "‌").

# Gettysburg’s Newest Museum

 _[Beyond the Battle](/visit/)_ was recently named **USA TODAY’s****Best New Museum** in the country. Here, you will embark on a thrilling journey through time featuring the true stories of civilians – before, during, and after they were caught in the crossfire of the Civil War’s deadliest battle.

[VISIT US](https://gettysburgbeyondthebattle.org/)

## Go Beyond the Battle of Gettysburg

Whether you’re a first-time visitor or lifelong history buff, the Adams County Historical Society will open your eyes to the civilian story – a new and exciting perspective on America’s most famous small town and the battle that changed the course of American history.

[JOIN US](/membership/)

## Caught in the Crossfire

 _Beyond the Battle’s_ premier exhibit is an immersive experience that uses cutting-edge technology to place visitors inside a meticulously reconstructed farmhouse during the Battle of Gettysburg. Visitors will see, hear, and feel what it was like for one Gettysburg family to be overrun by invading forces and trapped behind enemy lines.

[VISIT US](https://gettysburgbeyondthebattle.org/)

## DISCOVER THE CIVILIAN EXPERIENCE LIKE NEVER BEFORE

Step into the Shriver House Museum, where the chaos of war collided with the lives of ordinary civilians. Guided tours provide an intimate look at the battle—and the war’s—impact on the Shrivers and their neighbors.

[LEARN MORE](https://www.shriverhouse.org/)
